pr_title: Catch all exceptions json deserialization of mod metadata could throw.

timeline.message:
Catch all exceptions json deserialization could throw.

This prevents some more cryptic stack traces like this: https://gist.github.com/modmuss50/7c13acaed89a56b491430cbb08fd34d4

(cherry picked from commit 33a146fb779ccfe1f4c903fcd7ffb218e1fd1b84)

Add additional throwable catch case for other fun errors.

Also proper quoting lol for error messages

timeline.bodyText: Imo Errors should not be rethrown as runtime exceptions.
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: All of these exceptions kill the game though (or at least prevent it from being started normally) - would it make much of a difference to handle Errors differently to Exceptions?
replies.author: AlexIIL

replies.bodyText: (Plus any exception thrown here is ultimately wrapped in a ModResolutionException anyway).
replies.author: AlexIIL

replies.bodyText: Well one of the exceptions just sets the mod metadata array to be empty (NoSuchFileException)
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Yes, but as that's a checked exception it can only be thrown by Files.newInputStream() so it can't be thrown by this method (which means I think we can ignore it for this).
replies.author: AlexIIL

timeline.bodyText: Just FYI you probably don't need to make any changes to this file as it's all caught in ModResolver.
timeline.author: AlexIIL
